Welcome to Congressional Stock Trading Monitor’s documentation!¶

CSTM¶

CSTM Data Helpers¶

cstm.database_helpers.check_companies_advanced_search(request: flask.wrappers.Request) → bool¶

This method checks whether or not an advanced search was requested

Parameters

request – Flask Request containing the HTML Form Results from companies_table.html

Returns

True if an advanced search was requested or False if an advanced search was not requested.

cstm.database_helpers.check_transactions_advanced_search(request: flask.wrappers.Request) → bool¶

This method checks whether or not an advanced search was requested

Parameters

request – Flask Request containing the HTML Form Results from transactions_table.html

Returns

True if an advanced search was requested or False if an advanced search was not requested.

cstm.database_helpers.convert_db_transactions_to_dataclass(db_transactions: list[sqlite3.Row]) → list[cstm.dataclasses.Transaction]¶

This method takes a list of transactions from the database (matching the sql schema) and converts it to a list of Transaction dataclass objects.

Parameters

db_transactions – The list of transactions returned from a database query

Returns

The given list of transactions represented as Transaction objects

cstm.database_helpers.generate_select_query(selected_key: List[str], the_table_name: str, where_conditions: List[str] = [], group_by: str = '', order_by: str = '') → str¶

Vanilla, naive method of constructing a select query string

Parameters

  • group_by (str) – group by condition

  • order_by (str) – order by condition

  • the_table_name (string) – the name of the table which contains the keys we are looking for

  • selected_key (List of string) – name of keys that will be returned by the query

  • where_conditions (List of string) – list of where conditions

Returns

a string represent the SQLite select query

Return type

string

cstm.database_helpers.generate_string_like_condition(key_name: str, partial_string: str) → str¶

return a like condition for string(SQLite)

Parameters

  • key_name – the name of the key

  • partial_string – substring of the goal string (first name of the person for instance, or “Samsung”, instead of its full legal name).

Returns

a like condition for string in the form of XXX Like ‘%aa%’ or ‘TRUE’ if one of input is empty

cstm.database_helpers.generate_year_equal_condition(key_name: str, exact_year: str) → str¶

return an equal condition for year

Parameters

  • key_name (str) – the name of the key

  • exact_year (str) – a string represent the exact year we are looking for

Returns

an equal condition for time in the form of strftime(‘%Y’,key_name) = ‘exact_time}’ or ‘TRUE’ if one of input is empty

Return type

str

cstm.database_helpers.get_companies_advanced_search(request: flask.wrappers.Request) → list¶

This method creates the string for a database query for all companies that match the details in the given request.

Parameters

request – Flask Request containing the HTML Form Results from companies_table.html

Returns

A list of all companies from the database matching the given search parameters

cstm.database_helpers.get_companies_advanced_search_helper(request: flask.wrappers.Request) → tuple¶

This is a helper method for get_companies_advanced_search() that gets values from the HTML form in companies_table.html. This helper function also breaks down the queries into strings for get_companies_advanced_search() method.

Parameters

request – Flask Request containing the HTML Form Results from companies_table.html

Returns

A tuple of strings used for querying the database.

cstm.database_helpers.get_companies_btwn_years(method: str, request: flask.wrappers.Request, date_lower: datetime.date, date_upper: datetime.date) → list¶

This method makes a database query to list all companies with their corresponding ticker, the number of transactions including this company, the number of house members that made a transaction with this company, and the lower and upper bounds of stock purchases/sales. The query will return data that is between the date_lower and date_upper.

Parameters

  • method – string representing method calling this function (ex. “POST”, “GET”…)

  • request – Flask Request containing the HTML Form Results from companies_table.html

  • date_lower – The lower range of the transaction query

  • date_upper – The upper range of the transaction query

Returns

A list of all companies along with aggregated columns from the database within the given date range

cstm.database_helpers.get_db_connection(db_file: str = 'database/database.db')¶

Get the database connection

Parameters

db_file – Database file path

Returns

SQL3 Database Connection for the given file

cstm.database_helpers.get_earliest_year() → int¶

TODO: Don’t hardcode this :return: The first year for which a transaction exists in the database

cstm.database_helpers.get_latest_year() → int¶

TODO: Don’t hardcode this :return: The last year for which a transaction exists in the database

cstm.database_helpers.get_transactions_advanced_search(request: flask.wrappers.Request) → list¶

This method creates the string for a database query for all transactions that match the details in the given request.

Parameters

request – Flask Request containing the HTML Form Results from transaction_table.html

Returns

A list of all transactions from the database matching the given search parameters.

cstm.database_helpers.get_transactions_between(date_lower: datetime.date, date_upper: datetime.date) → list[cstm.dataclasses.Transaction]¶

This method makes a database query for all transactions that fall in the inclusive range from date_lower to date_upper. The transactions will be represented using the Transaction Dataclass.

Parameters

  • date_lower – The lower range of the transaction query

  • date_upper – The upper range of the transaction query

Returns

A list of all transactions from the database within the given range

cstm.database_helpers.get_transactions_btwn_years(method: str, request: flask.wrappers.Request, date_lower: datetime.date, date_upper: datetime.date) → list¶

This method makes a database query to list all transactions, with information including the U.S. House of Representatives name, U.S. House of Representative district, company, ticker, transaction type (purchase or sale), date, the lower and upper bound of the stock purchased/sold, description, and link to the official document showing the transaction.

Parameters

  • method – string represeting method calling this function (ex. “POST”, “GET”…)

  • request – Flask Request containing the HTML Form Results from transactions_table.html

  • date_lower – The lower range of the transaction query

  • date_upper – The upper range of the transaction query

Returns

A list of all transactions from the database within the given date range

CSTM Data Classes¶

class cstm.dataclasses.District(state: cstm.enums.State, number: int)¶

This class is responsible for storing information about a state congressional district

class cstm.dataclasses.Representative(name: str, district_by_year: dict[int, cstm.dataclasses.District], trade_count: int, purchase_count: int, sale_count: int, avg_transaction_value: float, total_purchase_range: tuple[float, float], total_sale_range: tuple[float, float])¶

This class is responsible for holding information about a member of the House of Representatives as well as facilitating computations using this data

class cstm.dataclasses.Transaction(id: int, member_name: str, member_district: cstm.dataclasses.District, company: str, ticker: str, type: cstm.enums.TransactionType, date: datetime.date, value_range: tuple[float, float], description: str)¶

This class is responsible for holding information about a single Transaction stored in the database. Database query functions will return a list of this type, providing a common data type and API system-wide.

get_average_value() → float¶
Returns

The average value of this transaction, which is the midpoint between its value bounds

CSTM Representative Helpers¶

cstm.representative_helpers.representative_list(date_lower: datetime.date, date_upper: datetime.date) → list[cstm.dataclasses.Representative]¶

This method make a database query for all Representatives that were in office at some point in the given date range

Parameters

  • date_lower – The lower bound of the query

  • date_upper – The upper bound of the query

Returns

A list of Representative objects populated from all transactions in the given range

cstm.representative_helpers.representatives_from_transactions(transactions: list[cstm.dataclasses.Transaction]) → list[cstm.dataclasses.Representative]¶

This method populates Representative objects with the information found in the given list of transactions

Parameters

transactions – The list of transactions to determine Representative info from

Returns

A list of Representative objects populated from the given transaction list

CSTM Query¶

cstm.query.aggregating_conditions(conditions: List[str])¶

aggregating a list of conditions. Auto-inject “AND” between conditions unless detect a specified “OR” condition

Parameters

conditions (list[str]) – list of conditions

Returns

aggregated condition

Return type

str

cstm.query.cases_str(expression: str, case_value_pairs: dict, else_value: Union[int, str], as_var_name: str, key_is_str: bool = False, value_is_str: bool = False)¶
return a string in the format of “CASE expression when exp_1 then … when exp_n then … ELSE else_value END as

as_var_name”. Used as a selected key. Currently, user has to make sure input is correct

Parameters

  • key_is_str (bool) – if the key should be a string, then TRUE, FALSE otherwise

  • value_is_str (bool) – if the value should be a string, then TRUE, FALSE otherwise

  • as_var_name (str) – the name we assign to this variable

  • expression (str) – the expression we are evaluating, could be empty

  • case_value_pairs (dict) – a dictionary where the key is the possible expression value, the value is the assign value

  • else_value (str or int) – the final assign value

Returns

the final case string

Return type

str

cstm.query.equal_condition(expression: str, exact_value: Union[int, str], value_is_string: bool = True) → str¶

return an equal condition for string (SQLite)

Parameters

  • value_is_string (bool) – whether the exact value is string or not

  • expression – the expression we are evaluating

  • exact_value – the expect value

Returns

an equal condition for string in the form of XXX = ‘aa’ or ‘TRUE’ if one of input is empty

cstm.query.expression_wrapper(expression: Union[str, int], is_str: bool) → str¶

wrap the value with quotation marks if we want it to be a string value in the query

Parameters

  • expression (Union[str, int]) – the expression we want to wrap up

  • is_str (bool) – a boolean indicating if the expression will be a str value in the query.

Returns

a str that is either ‘a’ or ‘’a’’

Return type

str

cstm.query.value_between(expression: str, lower_bound: Union[int, str], upper_bound: Union[int, str], bound_is_str: bool = False)¶

Return a between condition string (i.e.: A between lower_bound and upper_bound)

Parameters

  • bound_is_str (bool) – whether the bound value is str type or not

  • expression (str) – the expression we are examining

  • lower_bound (str or int) – value lower bound

  • upper_bound (str or int) – value upper bound

Returns

a between condition string

Return type

str

cstm.query.value_greater_equal(expression: str, exact_value: Union[int, str], bound_is_str: bool = False)¶

Return a greater than condition string (i.e.: greater then exact_value)

Parameters

  • bound_is_str (bool) – whether the bound value is str type or not

  • expression (str) – the expression we are examining

  • exact_value – the expect value

Returns

a greater than condition string

Return type

str

cstm.query.value_less_equal(expression: str, exact_value: Union[int, str], bound_is_str: bool = False)¶

Return a less than condition string (i.e.: less then exact_value)

Parameters

  • bound_is_str (bool) – whether the bound value is str type or not

  • expression (str) – the expression we are examining

  • exact_value – the expect value

Returns

a less than condition string

Return type

str

cstm.query.where_condition(var_name: str, var_value: Union[int, str]) → str¶

return a string representing the condition for where

Parameters

  • var_name – the name of the key which the variable corresponds to

  • var_value – the value of the variable

Returns

‘True’ if the var_value is None or empty string, ‘var_name = var_value’ otherwise
